messages.text:
We find ourselves in a more challenging situation than anticipated, which has significantly impacted our ability to communicate and stay organized. Many of those we have reached out to are either severely injured or unaccounted for, and a sense of panic has made it difficult for others to maintain contact.

At this moment, we need some time to recover and reorganised . Our commitment to you and to the memory of our martyrs remains unwavering. Despite the current disarray and damage, we promise not to give up. We are determined to come back stronger and share good news soon.

messages.text:
‚ÄºÔ∏èüö®Update üö®‚ÄºÔ∏è

Despite our strong leadership, many students we communicated with are experiencing severe mental distress. The government has implemented a sinister plan by providing internet access embedded with their tracking technology. They kidnapped many students last night too. Previously, the criminal regime did not possess such advanced technology and intelligence, leading us to believe that more sophisticated entities are now involved there from outside. 

We have confirmed that a portion of our military remains loyal to our country . The gov is trying to label this army part as religious extremism and has planned diplomatic maneuvers and planned terror attacks within Country to undermine protesters abroad. Religious protester may be targeted in the Western world specifically if you start your protest with religious scriptures , and active protesters could face manipulation by regime supporters by silently mixing with you . We urge our community to stay strategic, vigilant, and united.

However, any unarmed presence and protest on the streets, as we have done before, has become extremely difficult, and many of our leaders oppose such actions. The situation is incredibly challenging, and we are struggling to communicate effectively and make sound decisions. Nevertheless, we remain steadfast in our determination to remove these criminals from our country.

‚ÄºÔ∏èüö®Alert üö®‚ÄºÔ∏è

We ask all students, especially our private universities, not to fall into any traps that could create divisions between private and public university . This is a time for unity and focus on our single, shared demand. Stay united and resolute.

PUSAB knows how to recover and fight back effectively. We are on the right track now and will never give up. We promise not to betray our martyrs and victims.

text:
We should be prepared if there is another internet blackout. To communicate during an internet blackout, we can use Bridgefy, this was also used during the Ukrainian and Russian war
Bridgefy creates a mesh network, relaying messages through other users to extend communication range beyond direct Bluetooth connections.
* Connect to the internet (But only for the first time you use the app)
* Once done, all you need to do is turn " ON " Bluetooth on your smartphone device (Android and iPhone)
* Now, close the app completely 
* Then, you can turn off your internet and open the app to enjoy its services.
* However, for this app to work right, your friends and family must have the application too or the messages would not be sent because the application uses Bluetooth and not SMS or the internet.
* This will only work if there is a Bridgefy user within a 330 feet or 100 meter range. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs important for everyone to install this app. by doing that we can create a mesh network
For iOS:

messages.text:
!!üö®Statementüö®!! 

Following the clash regarding our movement, The government of Bangladesh has initiated a crackdown on protesters across the country, particularly in Dhaka. This crackdown targets not only members of opposition political parties but also any individuals involved in the recent movement. According to sources, law enforcement agencies are conducting raids on homes and detaining individuals, many of whom subsequently disappear for periods often exceeding 72 hours.

These actions have raised widespread concerns about the government's use of unlawful practices. We are deeply concerned about the wellbeing and whereabouts of the arrested students, indviduals.

messages.text:
‚ÄºÔ∏èüö®Updateüö®‚ÄºÔ∏è

Across the country, coordinated raids are being conducted tonight by joint forces, including the Police, RAB, and BGB. We have confirmed reports of gunfire in various areas of Dhaka throughout the night. Numerous accounts indicate that individuals, suspected to be from the Detective Branch (DB) or RAB, are detaining people in plain clothes from various locations.

Despite the government-imposed curfew, supporters of the ruling party are seen walking on the streets with heavy arms !

We call upon the international community and human rights organizations to take decisive action and urge the Bangladesh government to cease its unlawful suppression of protesters. We also encourage Bangladeshi citizens to take appropriate measures to safeguard themselves, document everything, and make every step count.

messages.text:
üö®!!Alert!!üö®

The government is deliberately instilling fear among the people in an effort to remove the evidence related to recent mass killing and protest in the country. 

There have been numerous reports of law enforcement agencies detaining students and individuals based on content found in their mobile phone galleries and social media posts. Many people have reported incidents where they were asked to present their phones at various checkpoints, where police personnel search their galleries and social media to identify their involvement in the protests. 

Additionally, there are alarming reports of missing persons, including students, following the discovery of protest-related photos or videos on their devices. This raises serious concerns regarding privacy and adherence to standard procedural practices.

Protesters said these tactics are intended to create widespread panic and fear, thereby pressuring individuals to delete all evidence and documentation of the protests. 

To ensure the safety and preservation of such records, it is suggested that these documents be sent to Bangladeshi's residing abroad or store in cloud services.

messages.text:
üö®DAILY UPDATEüö®

We have received confirmed reports of incidents occurring across the country, with a particular focus on Dhaka. The details are as follows:

       ‚Ä¢   Block raids are being conducted in various areas by joint forces. During these operations, individuals have been arrested. These raids are targeting locations where protesters had a strong presence during recent demonstrations.
 ‚Ä¢ A significant number of individuals are being detained randomly at different checkpoints throughout the city. According to reliable sources, the police are inspecting phones, and those found with footage or photographs are facing harassment, physical assault, or arrest.
 ‚Ä¢ There are confirmed reports of students being apprehended by plainclothes law enforcement personnel. Few of them were reported later in local Police stations. But many are yet to be located. 
 ‚Ä¢ There are increased patrolling in areas with large student populations, including Bashundhara, Badda, Mirpur, Rampura, and Uttara.
      ‚Ä¢    There are new reports of death and the number is increasing. Critically injured (Mostly from bullets) protesters are fighting for their lives in hospitals. Atleast 10,000+ people were injured last week among them atleast 2500+ were seriously injured. 

We express our deep concern for the safety of the general public and students.

messages.text:
üö® Mirpur DOHS Updateüö®

Joint forces, led by the Police & RAB and supported by the Army, are planning to conduct a raid tonight in Mirpur DOHS and its surrounding areas. A significant number of vehicles have been observed in the area. Pictures of these veichles are being circulated in social medias.

It is surprising to see the Army supporting this operation, especially considering that DOHS is home to many retired and current officers. 
Additionally, Students from Bangladesh University of Professionals (BUP), Military Institute of Science and Technology (MIST)and other colleges reside in this area.

text:
üö®Do Not Forgetüö®

It is important that we understand the number of deaths far exceeds what is portrayed on social media. We are only seeing a fraction of the total deaths.

This movement led by students, involved a significant number of individuals from Mid to low and lower-income segments who were not students. The participation was broad, large number of general citizens fought alongside the students. Unfortunately,  Government has tagged these individuals as BNP-Jamaat or similar groups.

It is crucial that we honor every life lost. We should not focus solely on a few names but remember each person who died protesting and fighting for the justice. These individuals are our true heroes, who took to the streets to oppose the violence  by the police, RAB, BGB, and the goons of the Awami League.

We request all of you to honor everyone who died out there.

messages.text:
‚ÄºÔ∏èüö®Statementüö®‚ÄºÔ∏è

We observe that the gov force‚Äôs detective branches are extremely aggressive, targeting any young individuals indiscriminately. Every night feels like a horror movie, with countless people disappearing without a trace.

Our verified reports indicate that these detective branches are forcibly entering homes without prior notice, breaking locks and invading bedrooms silently without maintaining any privacy. We urgently call upon all international human rights organizations to intervene and halt these unlawful activities. We also implore our fellow citizens abroad to persist in voicing their concerns and advocating for justice.

messages.text:
üö® Statement üö®

Bangladesh is 'Red' today. As of July 30, the people of Bangladesh, particularly students, are changing their social media profiles to red in solidarity with the martyrs of the recent movement. Yesterday, the government declared a one-day period of mourning for the victims in recent movement‚Äîtragically, many hundreds were killed by government agencies and thousands others where injured severely.

The students and protesters have rejected this announcement, stating that the government, who ordered the shootings, has yet to take visible steps to punish those responsible. Instead, they are doing nationwide raids, arresting students and individuals. 

This message is directed at international media and representatives: today, observe Bangladesh and note where the general public stands. The majority supports the protesters, while only a few‚Äîoften fake accounts managed by official authorities‚Äîattempt to alter the narrative.

messages.text:
üö®Statementüö®

Students and general protesters have declined any opportunity for dialogue with the current government. They have stated that, following the killing of hundreds of protesters by gunfire, a week-long massive crackdown, raids, arrests of students, the filing of thousands of police cases, and attacks from ruling party activists, there is no room for further discussion. They expressed  that the only viable solution is to meet their one point demand.

messages.text:
‚ÄºÔ∏èüö®Announcement üö®‚ÄºÔ∏è

From this moment forward, students and people across Bangladesh will unite in protest to remove this criminal party from power.

As PUSAB already announced on July 19th, we demand the removal of the perpetrators responsible for heinous crimes. The entire nation now declares that this regime and their leader, Sheikh Hasina, are primarily responsible for these atrocities.

We remain determined to achieve our goal, as we always have been. We urge our nation to maintain this unity and stay focused, especially during the challenging days ahead.

messages.text:
‚ÄºÔ∏èüö®Statementüö®‚ÄºÔ∏è

We are deeply concerned about recent news from Noakhali and Chittagong, where it appears that the Awami League has intentionally attacked Hindu residences to discredit our movement. 

All the residents of Bangladesh want the removal of this party, and we fear this is why the party is targeting Hindus, as they are also actively involved in this movement. 

We want to assure our international friends that we, the students, stand firmly against all forms of discrimination and injustice. This tactic is a familiar pattern by this party during their time in power. We hold them responsible for these reprehensible actions against innocent activists.

messages.text:
üö®Statementüö®

Today, August 5th, 2024, the world will witness one of the largest peaceful movements in the history of Bangladesh. Students and general protesters will march towards the capital, demanding the removal of the fascist Sheikh Hasina and her government.

The government has already declared a curfew and implemented strong security measures nationwide with the help of the military, paramilitary, and police forces. Protesters have rejected the curfew and announced they will take to the streets today. 

Yesterday, over 100 people died during the protest when ruling party supporters and police attacked the demonstrators. They even torched several locations to sabotage the protest. Since the movement began in early July, there have been at least 350 official deaths, with actual numbers likely much higher.

We urge everyone to be vigilant and look after the safety of the protesters today. We call upon the Bangladesh Army and Armed Forces Division to stand with the people.

- Private University Students Alliance Of Bangladesh (PUSAB)

üö®Updateüö®

Millions of protesters are now in the streets of Dhaka city. Every one from every place is marching towards Shahabag. A big procession is heading from Uttara towards the place. Another big procession is taking place at Mirpur, Jatrabari area. Several other places are also under the control of people. We are still hearing about gun shots from few places, But most of the place are free.

Students are seen on army APC in several places. People are stating it as a revolution. 

Army Cheif is to address the country at 3 PM. We welcome that, but the facist government must be reomved and be punished. There shall not be free pass to any killer.

messages.text:
üö®Suggestingüö®

At this critical moment, we suggest the following solution: Students should announce and validate the start of a government led by Dr. Younus. The Home Ministry and Defence Ministry can be headed by personnel from within the Army , allowing the government to start functioning immediately.

All other ministries can continue working under their main secretaries, with the appointment of ministers to be finalized later.

Please understand that every second is crucial. We can begin with a small cabinet and make necessary adjustments later.

messages.text:
Our Professor Dr. Yousuf Mahbubul Islam has just confirmed his consent for further proceedings regarding his candidacy for the upcoming Cabinet. We will now try to take the next steps on his behalf.

Here are some points on how he can serve our country:

Professor Yousuf Islam is highly professional and comes from a strong background in computer science. In this age of technological revolution, he can significantly contribute to sustainable development in our science, technology, and research sectors.

We acknowledge some negative comments from a few students about his political acumen in handling the current situation. However, it's important to understand that there are others in the Cabinet who can cover this gap.

Our professor is also a good friend of Muhammad Yunus , which will help to ensure a unified direction for the Cabinet.

messages.text:
We chose to remain silent and not disclose any names to avoid insulting our students and disrupting our unity.

However, we must now address a particular individual: Ayatullah from NSU. While we acknowledge that he was active in the protests and had positive contributions, recent actions require us to provide specific information about him:
1.He has been speaking against the students' call for the removal of the Vice-Chancellor at NSU.

2.Yesterday, he sent a BSL-aligned committee member to Channel 24 to represent private universities without proper authorization.

3.Ayatullah intentionally included his girlfriend's name in the coordinating committee recognized by the DU students.

Today, Ayatullah and his close associate, Shanto, went to DU without our students' consent to carry out an unknown agenda. We urge our students to question him about the purpose of his visit and the agenda behind it.

We have previous experience with Ayatullah. He falsely claimed to be a representative of PUSAB at EWU to gain attention and popularity. He has never been an official representative of our platform , and our members do not share their connections with PUSAB, as it is against our policy.

messages.text:
An Unimportant Reaction to the Disgusting Topic!

The DU students clarified some points in their meeting without PUSAB Involvement, Just as we previously monitored the activities of BSL, we now have to track a new development. We are uncertain when this responsibility will end !
1.Two of their members are expected to join the upcoming government cabinet. We know which names are being discussed but prefer not to disclose them.

2.They are planning to establish a political party as soon as possible. We assume this is why they are forming committees everywhere to build a strong foundation.

3.In the upcoming government formation ceremony , there might be three students from private universities, but they will be chosen by their own selection process, with no discussion with PUSAB yet.
It is alarming to see former BSL member Sarjish Alam as a key figure in communicating and focusing on the private university side. We urge our students to be alert regarding him.

From our side, we want to make our stance clear: We want to focus on our studies and avoid extreme politics right now. We do not support student involvement in the cabinet at this time. While we will always appreciate good work, our strategy will focus solely on the benefits of private university students without conflicting with national issues.

We will strongly oppose any form of politics in our universities, including their new party, Chhatra Dal, Shibir, and left-wing movements. We will maintain zero tolerance towards this. This does not mean we will be ignorant about politics; we will stay informed but not become activists. We have enough clubs to develop leadership.

We are open to friendly discussions if they wish. However, our strategy will remain the same. If you support our decision, please continue supporting us.

text.text: "States shall take all appropriate measures to prevent or minimize the causing of significant harm to other states."

text_entities.text: "States shall take all appropriate measures to prevent or minimize the causing of significant harm to other states."

text.text: Convention on the Protection and Use of Transboundary Watercourses and International Lakes (1992) ,Article 2, Paragraph 6 :

"The Parties shall prevent, control and reduce any transboundary impact, and for this purpose shall take all appropriate measures to prevent, control and reduce the release of hazardous substances, discharges, or emissions which may have a significant adverse impact on transboundary waters."

text: This law mandates that states sharing watercourses must take all necessary steps to avoid actions that could have significant adverse effects on neighboring states. India's release of water, leading to flooding in Bangladesh, clearly violates this principle.

messages.text:
We want to remind the Indian authorities that harboring a criminal, dictator, and alleged murderer like Sheikh Hasina, who faces serious charges in Bangladesh, violates international law. 

Under the United Nations Convention against Transnational Organized Crime (UNTOC) and the principles of international customary law, states are obligated not to shelter individuals accused of serious crimes, including human rights violations. 

Article 16 of the UNTOC emphasizes the duty of states to extradite or prosecute such individuals. Granting her asylum or facilitating her escape to another country would breach these obligations and severely damage the trust and goodwill between our nations. Such actions would deeply hurt us and provoke widespread anger among the people of Bangladesh. 

We urge India to respect its international responsibilities and ensure Sheikh Hasina is returned to Bangladesh to face justice as early as possible.

messages.text:
BUBT issue : 

We are deeply concerned about the recent activities targeting some innocent students of BUBT. If your intention is to improve the country's system by unjustly arresting and harassing students, we will not remain silent. We will demand a fair and justice based system where everyone involved in the tragic death of Dibto is held accountable, regardless of the consequences to the current system ( We are not against doctors). 

PUSAB high command has been in communication with the DMC protesters and other related parties in an effort to resolve the issue peacefully. We are actively continuing our discussions, and so far, all parties have responded positively. Any external involvement at this stage will be considered as interference from a third party.

While we have remained quiet about the arrests of other students, we will no longer stand by if any innocent students are harassed. Once we open our mouth & speak up, other voices will follow, and it won‚Äôt be long before other organs become active as well. 

The entire nation is well aware of the impact Private University students can have. We urge the authorities to handle this matter with fairness and with care.

If your intention is to improve the country's system by unjustly arresting and harassing students, we will not remain silent. We will demand a fair and justice based system where everyone involved in the tragic death of Dibto is held accountable, regardless of the consequences to the current system ( We are not against doctors). 

PUSAB high command has been in communication with the DMC protesters and other related parties in an effort to resolve the issue peacefully. We are actively continuing our discussions, and so far, all parties have responded positively. Any external involvement at this stage will be considered as interference from a third party.

While we have remained quiet about the arrests of other students, we will no longer stand by if any innocent students are harassed. Once we open our mouth & speak up, other voices will follow, and it won‚Äôt be long before other organs become active as well. 

The entire nation is well aware of the impact Private University students can have. We urge the authorities to handle this matter with fairness and with care.

messages.text:
Update: 20th September,2024 

There has been confirmed news of communal violence in the hill tracks of Bangladesh. On September 19, violence started after Mamun, a man of Bengali origin, was killed in mob violence. Mamun was flagged as motorcycle theif. During a protest over this incident, protesters were attacked by indigenous groups, leading to clashes. Shops and markets were burned, and many people were injured. People fled from their homes in fear of the violance. 

Law enforcement agencies attempted to negociate between the two groups but were unsuccessful. Gunshots were heard overnight; the army fired blank ammunition, but some sources claimed armed groups were firing as well. After a night of fear, the violence spread to other areas of the hill tracks today. Clashes occurred in several locations, with religious places, shops, and homes being attacked by both groups. 

The administration declared a 144, but it has not been effective, and violence is increasing. Army patrols have been deployed but have faced blockades from local indigenous groups. Locals are alleging that armed militia forces are using indigenous people as cover to spread the violence.

We strongly condemn any conspiracy against the hill tracks and the country's independence. However, we strongly oppose any oppression against the indigenous communities in the area. We urge everyone to stay vigilant and follow the instructions of law enforcement agencies.

-PUSAB

‚ÄºÔ∏èüö®Statementüö®‚ÄºÔ∏è

As we all know, the Honorable Chief Adviser GOB recently called for National Unity and organized a meeting with student representatives. However, we are disappointed to note that mostly Dhaka University students were present, with no representation from private universities.

Private university students have made significant contributions to the movements of 2024, yet their efforts continue to go unrecognized. Such exclusions undermine the inclusivity and fairness that a call for national unity demands.

We urge the authorities to ensure that private university students are included in future discussions and initiatives, recognizing their vital role in shaping the nation‚Äôs future.
